dc_title_s: A new map of the Province of Quebec, according to the Royal Proclamation, of the 7th of October 1763 : from the French surveys connected with those made after the war
dc_description_s: "Degrees of longitude west from London."; Relief shown pictorially.; Scale determined by conversion of graphic scale (British miles).; Three graphic scales: British miles; Nautic leagues; and Canadian leagues about two miles each.; Four inset maps: A particular survey of the isles of Montreal; The city of Quebec; Course of the river St. Laurence, from La Valterie to Quebec; and Plan of Montreal, or Villemarie.|49 x 67 Centimeters|Scale approximately 1:2,252,800|General Map Collection
dc_publisher_s: printed for Robt. Sayer and John Bennett (London)
